messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Could you clarify what you mean by “later”?  
• Do you want to see tasks due later today, sometime this week, or just any upcoming tasks in the future?  
• If you have more than one to-do list, is there a specific list you’d like to check? Let me know and I’ll pull up the right reminders.
Just what's coming up today works.

Sure—just to be certain I’m grabbing the right window of time, could you let me know:

• What date “today” is for you (e.g., 3 June 2025)?  
• Your time zone (so I know when the day starts and ends)?

Once I have that, I’ll pull up everything scheduled for the rest of today.
I don't have that info on hand right now. Could you look it up for me?

I don’t have direct access to your device or calendar, so I can’t automatically detect your current date or time zone. To make sure I pull the right reminders for “today,” could you tell me either

• the city (or at least the time-zone name / UTC offset) you’re in, or  
• today’s date where you are?

With just one of those pieces of information, I’ll be able to fetch everything that’s still due today.
Hmm, okay. I'm not sure of the timezone or date exactly. Can you check based on the device setting or location?

I’m sorry—I don’t have a way to read your device’s clock or location automatically.  
To make sure I pull the correct “today” window, please give me just one of the two details below:

1. The city (or time-zone name / UTC offset) you’re currently in  
-or-  
2. Today’s date where you are (e.g., 5 Oct 2026)

Even a rough answer (e.g., “I’m on Eastern Time” or “it’s the 4th where I am”) is enough for me to fetch everything due today.
